article_title: Spring has sprung: Time to start the garden!
article_text:
The general manager even gave tips on what you need to know before you start digging and planting seeds.

“If you are going to get some really cold nights, you might just want to cover them up with either some newspaper or sheen or bed cloth or something,” said Dennis Keady, Garden Factory General Manager. “People are starting to put their fertilizers down and your first step to any kind of program if you will, would be a crabgrass premergent and that should be going down now within the next ten days or so.”

article_metadata.description: With spring weather finally arriving in Rochester, a lot of you are probably excited to get out and start working around your yard; planting flowers or even vegetables in your garden!

article_summary:
The general manager even gave tips on what you need to know before you start digging and planting seeds.
“If you are going to get some really cold nights, you might just want to cover them up with either some newspaper or sheen or bed cloth or something,” said Dennis Keady, Garden Factory General Manager.
“People are starting to put their fertilizers down and your first step to any kind of program if you will, would be a crabgrass premergent and that should be going down now within the next ten days or so.”
